The community is competitive and non-newbie-friendly, the game is violent, and it obviously attempts to train kids to be murderers. As a Christian and a father, I do not recommend you buy this for your children, unless you wish to corrupt their innocent minds, replacing God's love with a lust for violence.

This was made before COD. And this is what current COD games have copied to get followers. I used to respect COD before all of their games have basically just become this game except with slightly better graphics. This game however; is still better than COD. Buy it already! If you want real warfare go for Battlefield or RO (any titles except BF 2142). If you want fast-paced running around corners to shoot people: This game will always beat COD.

There are thousands of better multi-player shooter games out there. For some inexplicable reason Counter Strike (in all it's shitty glory) seems to have attracted and sustained the largest fan-base. Overall there is nothing remarkable about this title, but ask another ten or twenty people and you'll likely find a lot of positive opinions.

Outrageous fun with guns. With the pleasantly surprising option to play as the SAS and a couple of other counter terrorist units, as well as the increasingly tiresome American special forces. This game is hard, I wouldn't lie to you my dear fellow customers, but its good fun once you get the hang of it and with only a limited number on each team (usually 8 vs 8), the action is tense rather than mad. Perhaps the most important point to make here, is that you can score refined upper class superiority points when among peers who play the so called "cod" by saying that "actually, I play counter strike, because your call of duty is far too easy and just generally uncivilised." You will also be very popular at dinner parties and there is considerable scientific evidence to suggest that people who play one game of counter strike: source per day, live forever, earn 35.6% more than those that don't and have much less chance of developing wrinkles and/or beer bellies in old age.
